text:
Routing tutorial

When Mvcjs starts processing a requested URL, the first step it takes is to parse the URL into a route The route is then used to instantiate the corresponding controller action to handle the request. This whole process is called routing.

Routes

End users address actions through the so-called routes. A route is a string that consists of the following parts:

  • a controller ID: a string that uniquely identifies the controller among all controllers within the same application (or the same module if the controller belongs to a module);
  • an action ID: a string that uniquely identifies the action among all actions within the same controller.

Routes take the following format: ControllerID/ActionID

Static routes

All routes are executed in order as thy are defined!

router.add([ { pattern: 'user/<view:(\\d+)>', // matches /user/1, /user/2 route: 'user/view' // controller user action view }, { pattern: 'home/<action>', // matches /home/index /home/contact route: 'home/<action>' // controller home action any }, { pattern: 'contact', // matches /contact route: 'home/contact' // controller home action contact }, { pattern: '<controller>/<action>', // matches /home/index /user/index /user/view route: '<controller>/<action>' // controller any action any }, { pattern: 'user/<action:(create|view|update|delete)>', // matches /user/create /user/view /user/update /user/delete route: 'user/<action>' // controller user action (create|view|update|delete) }, { pattern: 'user/<action:(update|view|delete)>/<id:(\\d+)>', // matches /user/update/5 /user/view/10 /user/delete/1000 route: 'user/<action>' // controller user action (update|view|delete) } ]); router.add({ pattern: '/', // matches / route: 'home/index' // controller home action index });

Dynamic routes

router.add([ { dynamic: true, constructor: di.load('@{envPath}/dynamic-router') } ]); router.add({ pattern: '/', // matches / route: 'home/index' // controller home action index });

Dynamic router:

var di = require('mvcjs'), RouteRuleInterface = di.load('interface/routeRule'), menuModel = di.load('@{modelsPath}/menu'), Promise = di.load('promise'), MenuRoute; MenuRoute = RouteRuleInterface.inherit({}, { parseRequest: function(method, route) { return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) { menuModel.findOne({link: route.pathname}, function(err, data) { if (!!data && !!data.route) { resolve([data.route, route.query]); // route must be returned as array format ['home/index', {id: 1}] string, object params }else { resolve(false); } }); }); }, createUrl: function(route, params) { if (route === 'custom/route') { // match route if (params.link) { return params.link; // return custom link from params } } return false; /* Eg: { "title": "Routing", "link": "/getting-started/routing", "route": "custom/route", // controller custom action route "blank": false } */ } }); module.exports = MenuRoute;
pageDesc: Tutorial for routing component,  when Mvcjs starts processing a requested URL, the first step it takes is to parse the URL

text:
Components

Components host a set of the so-called application components that provide different services for processing requests.
For example, the core/router component is responsible for routing Web requests to appropriate controllers; the core/db component provides mogodb services; and so on.
All components are singleton objects in system.

Core Components

  • core/logger
  • core/router
  • core/favicon
  • core/view
  • core/assets
  • db/mongo
  • cache/memory

Bootstrapping Components

As mentioned above, an application component will only be instantiated when it is being accessed the first time.
Usually that is happening at bootstrapping application but thy can be bootstrapped at some controller model.
You can always override default core component and provide own implementation of some core component.

Bootstraping over environment.json

"components": [ { "name": "core/logger", "enabled": true, "write": true, "publish": true, "console": false, "port": 9001, "file": "server.log" }, { "name": "core/router", "errorRoute": "core/error" }, { "name": "core/favicon", "path": "@{basePath}/favicon.ico" }, { "name": "core/view", "themes": "@{appPath}/themes/", "views": "@{appPath}/views/", "theme": "default", "cache": false }, { "name": "core/assets", "path": "@{basePath}/storage/", "hook": "^\\/assets" }, { "name": "db/mongo", "connection": "mongodb://localhost/testdb" } ]

Providing custom core implementation

"components": [ { "name": "core/logger", "filePath": "@{appPath}/core/my-logger-implementation" "enabled": true, "write": true, "publish": true, "console": false, "port": 9001, "file": "server.log" } ]

Creating custom component

Component can be initialized to system in two ways over environment.json
Your component must be function type!

"components": [ { "name": "app/core/custom", "filePath": "@{appPath}/core/mycustom" "a1": 1, "b2": 2, "port": 9001 } ]

Initializing over config.js

module.exports = function (componet, di) { "use strict"; component.set('custom-redis', { a1: 1, b1: 2, filePath: di.load('@{appPath}/core/redis-cache') }); // or component.set('custom-redis', { a1: 1, b1: 2 }, di.load('@{appPath}/core/redis-cache')); // or component.set('custom-redis', { a1: 1, b1: 2 }, function myConstructor(config) { this.config = config; }); };

Example of component: /app/core/redis-cache

"use strict"; var di = require('mvcjs'), Type = di.load('typejs'), CacheInterface = di.load('interface/cache'), error = di.load('error'), redis = di.load('app/redis'), // this is not implemented in core its just an example RedisCache; /** * @name MemoryCache * @constructor * @description * Memory cache */ RedisCache = CacheInterface.inherit({ config: Type.OBJECT },{ _construct: function (config) { // In case from top { a1: 1, b1: 2 } this.config = config; }, set: function RedisCache_set(key, value, ttl) { if (!this.cache.hasOwnProperty(key) || this.cache[key] === null) { redis.set(key, value); } else { return false; } if (Type.isNumber(ttl) && !isNaN(ttl) && ttl > 0) { setTimeout(clearCache.bind(this), ttl); } else { setTimeout(clearCache.bind(this), this.ttl); } function clearCache() { this.remove(key); } return true; }, get: function RedisCache_getValue(key) { return redis.get(key); }, remove: function RedisCache_remove(key) { redis.remove(key); } }); module.exports = RedisCache;
pageDesc: Components host a set of the so-called application components that provide different services for processing requests.

text:
Logger

Logger is component in system, see more about components.

"components": [ { "name": "core/logger", // name of component "enabled": true, // is logger enabled "write": true, // should be written to disk ? "publish": true, // publish to port 9001 "console": false, // log it in console "port": 9001, // log publish port "file": "server.log" // log file }, ]

Log displayed in iframe

View logger in new page.

Logger hooks

Add logger hook in env config to store in db:

module.exports = function (componet, di) { "use strict"; var viewLoader, logger = componet.get('core/logger'), loggerModel = di.load('@{modelsPath}/logger'); logger.addHook(loggerModel.save.bind(loggerModel)); }

How to use logger ?

Load logger in to your controller/model/component

var di = require('mvcjs'), // mvcjs as node package component = di.load('core/component'), logger = component.get('core/logger'); /// eg. in your controller action logger.print('Some message', {}, 'as many arguments as you want and it could be any type');
pageDesc: Logger is component in system, use logger to log components,models,controllers,services in sytem

text:
Controllers

Features

  • Controllers can be inherited.
  • Controllers are loaded only once on request when is needed.
  • Controllers are instantiated on each request.
  • Easy to test.

Methods which can be called in controllers

  • stopChain();
  • renderFile(path {string}, locals {object}); -> return in action
  • render(template {string}, locals {object}, escape {boolean}); -> return in action
  • redirect(route {string}, params {object}); -> return in action
  • forward(route {string}, params {object}); -> return in action
  • createUrl(route {string}, params {object});
  • onEnd(callback (function)); -> request end event
  • addHeader(name {string}, value {string}); -> response
  • hasHeader(name {string}); -> response
  • getHeaders(); -> response
  • getMethod(); -> request
  • getRequestHeader(name {string}); -> request
  • getRequestHeaders(); -> request
  • isHeaderCacheUnModified();
  • sendNoChange();
  • getParsedUrl();
  • has(actionName {string}); internally used by framework
  • get(actionName {string}); internally used by framework

As you can see on image in right side, app structure is pretty clear.

Core controller example

var di = require('mvcjs'), // mvcjs as node package Type = di.load('typejs'), Controller = di.load('code/controller'), widgetHooks = di.load('@{code}/widget-hook'), CoreController; // load widget menu, as menu-hook alias and for menu-hook alias use hook method widgetHooks.load('menu', 'menu-hook', 'hook'); /** * @license Mit Licence 2014 * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @name CoreController * * @constructor * @description * Core controller , most controllers are inherited from code controller */ CoreController = Controller.inherit({ locals: Type.OBJECT, menu: Type.ARRAY }, { /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method CoreController#_construct * * @description * On construct set some defaults */ _construct: function() { this.locals = { scripts: [], brand: 'MVCJS', pageTitle: 'Mvcjs nodejs framework', pageDesc: 'Mvcjs fast, opinionated lightweight mvc framework for Node.js inspired by Yii framework' }; this.menu = []; }, /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method CoreController#beforeEach * * @description * This is executed before each action * @return {object} Promise */ beforeEach: function Core_beforeEach() { // handle hooks return widgetHooks.handle(['menu-hook']); // run menu alias }, /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method CoreController#action_error * * @description * Error handler for application * @return {*|string} */ action_error: function Core_error(error) { this.locals.pageTitle = 'Error - mvcjs nodejs framework'; this.locals.text = error.toString().replace(/\\n/g, '\n'); return this.renderFile('home/error', this.locals); } }); module.exports = CoreController;

Home controller example inherited by code

var di = require('mvcjs'), // mvcjs as node package CoreController = di.load('@{controllersPath}/code'), contentModel = di.load('@{modelsPath}/content'), code = di.load('code'), Promise = di.load('promise'), HomeController; /** * @license Mit Licence 2014 * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @name HomeController * * @constructor * @description * Home controller is responsible for home actions */ HomeController = CoreController.inherit({}, { /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method HomeController#action_index * * @description * Index action request * @return {*|string} */ action_index: function HomeController_action_index(params, data) { var packageJson = JSON.parse(di.readFileSync('@{basePath}/package.json')); this.locals.scripts.push({ src: 'https://buttons.github.io/buttons.js', id: 'github-bjs', async: true }); if (packageJson && packageJson.dependencies && packageJson.dependencies.mvcjs) { this.locals.version = packageJson.dependencies.mvcjs; } return this.renderFile('home/index', this.locals); }, /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method HomeController#beforeEach * * @description * This is executed before each action * @return {object} Promise */ beforeEach: function HomeController_beforeEach() { var _parentBeforeEachPromise = this._super(); this.locals.scripts.push({ src: '/assets/js/prism.js' }); return _parentBeforeEachPromise; }, /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method HomeController#before_content * * @description * Before content action do some data handling * @return {object} Promise */ before_content: function HomeController_before_content(params, data) { var pathName = this._request.parsedUrl.pathname; return new Promise(function(resolve, reject) { contentModel.findOne({url: pathName}, function (err, data) { if (err) { reject(err) } else { resolve(data); } }); }); }, /** * @since 0.0.1 * @author Igor Ivanovic * @method HomeController#action_content * * @description * Content action is responsible for displaying dynamic content * @return {*|string} */ action_content: function HomeController_content(params, data) { if (data) { if (data.text) { this.locals.content = data.text; } if (data.pageTitle) { this.locals.pageTitle = data.pageTitle; } if (data.pageDesc) { this.locals.pageDesc = data.pageDesc; } } return this.renderFile('home/content', this.locals); } }); module.exports = HomeController;

stopChain();

Stop execution of promise chain

{ before_content: function(params, data) { if (params.someLogic) { this.stopChain(); return 'SOME-DATA'; } }, action_content: function (params, data) { // this will not be executed when some logic is there // instead 'SOME-DATA' will be rendered in that case return this.renderFile('home/content', this.locals); } }

renderFile(path {string}, locals {object});

Render file from path eg: 'home/content' will try render first from '@{themesPath}/{{theme}}/home/content' and if fails then will try render file from '@{viewsPath}/home/content' if that fails error 500 will be thrown

{ action_content: function (params, data) { return this.renderFile('home/content', this.locals); } }

render(template {string}, locals {object}, escape {boolean});

Render template. Param template is string to be compiled Param locals is object which is passed as data to view handler Param escape is boolean to escape html or not to escape

{ action_content: function (params, data) { this.locals.title = 'from local'; this.locals.id = params.id; return this.render('My template {{title}} {{id}}', this.locals, true); } }

redirect(route {string}, params {object});

Redirect to different route in case below will redirect to /home/index

{ action_permanent: function () { this.redirect(this.createUrl('home/index', {id: 1})); }, action_temporary: function () { this.redirect(this.createUrl('home/index', {id: 1}), true); } }

forward(route {string}, params {object});

Forward to different route. Forward must be returned to promise chain!

{ action_user_view: function () { return this.forward('user/login', {hash: 'something'}); } }

createUrl(route {string}, params {object});

Create route from defined routes. So if you add route like {pattern: 'user/<id:(\\d+)>', route: 'user/view'} And you call this.createUrl('user/view', {id: 1}) will generate /user/1 url

{ // {pattern: 'user/<id:(\\d+)>', route: 'user/view'} action_view: function () { var url = this.createUrl('user/view', {id: 1}); // /user/1 this.locals.url = url; return this.renderFile('home/index', this.locals); } }

onEnd(callback {function});

This is request.on('end', callback); This is destroyed with request itself

{ action_view: function () { this.onEnd(function() { // do some destroy if you need }); return this.renderFile('home/index', this.locals); } }

addHeader(name {string}, value {string});

Add response header eg. Content-type By default content type is text/html so you don't need to provide content type header

{ action_view: function () { this.addHeader('Content-type', 'application/javascript'); // override content type this.stopChain(); // stop chain for eg. after each function return 'function exec(){ return 1; }'; } }

hasHeader(name {string});

Check if response header is al ready present

{ action_view: function () { this.hasHeader('Content-type'); // false this.addHeader('Content-type', 'application/javascript'); // override content type this.hasHeader('Content-type'); // true } }

getHeaders();

Return all response headers

{ action_parse: function () { this.addHeader('Content-type', 'application/javascript'); var requestHeaders = this.getHeaders(); } }

getMethod();

Return request method

{ action_parse: function () { this.getMethod() // eg: 'GET' } }

getRequestHeader(name {string});

Return request header

function cookieParser(cookie) { return cookie.split(';').map(function(item) { var i = item.split('='); return { key: i.shift(), value: i.shift() } }); } { action_parse: function () { var cookie = this.getRequestHeader('Cookie'); var parsed = cookieParser(cookie); /* eg: __atuvc=6%7C48; session_id=bec2560b3f30550ddb6450cbc09981d7 [ { key: '__atuvc', value: '6%7C48' }, { key: 'session_id', value: 'bec2560b3f30550ddb6450cbc09981d7' } ] */ } }

getRequestHeaders();

Return all request headers

{ action_parse: function () { var requestHeaders = this.getRequestHeaders(); } }

isHeaderCacheUnModified();

Check if cache is un modified

{ action_parse: function () { if (this.isHeaderCacheUnModified()) { return this.sendNoChange(); /// 304 response } } }

sendNoChange();

Return 304 response

{ action_parse: function () { return this.sendNoChange(); /// 304 response } }

getParsedUrl();

Return parsed url url api

{ action_parse: function () { var parsed_url = this.getParsedUrl(); parsed_url.pathname; // eg. '/home/index', parsed_url.query; // eg. {id: 1, test: 'b'}, } }
